(Polygon)</resTitle><date><createDate>2013-12-04T00:00:00</createDate><reviseDate>2014-03-21T00:00:00</reviseDate></date><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum>208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:15 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="010" /></role></citRespParty><presForm><fgdcGeoform>vector digital data</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="005" Sync="TRUE" /></presForm></idCitation><idAbs><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN STYLE="font-weight:bold;">The 2013 Sage-grouse Habitat Planning Map update incorporates wildfire data and other edits relevant to the 2013 field and fire season as per typical processes used during the past decade. Additional areas of non-habitat, such as paved highways, municipal boundaries, water bodies etc., were also removed. However, the map extent for sage-grouse key habitat and potential restoration areas should be considered provisional, contingent on the final outcome of additional analyses currently underway in association with the national Greater Sage-grouse Conservation Strategy.</SPAN></P><P><SPAN>This data set contains simple, landscape-scale greater sage-grouse habitat types for Idaho and constitutes a current approximation of sage-grouse habitat in the state. The data can be used for general conservation and restoration planning purposes, but additional data or field verification are needed for applications at finer scales. The habitat types include: (1) key sage-grouse habitat areas and (2) four habitat restoration types: (a) R1 - perennial native and non-native grasslands with high restoration potential; (b) R2 - annual grass dominated areas (either shrubland or grassland) with low restoration potential; (c) R3 - conifer encroachment areas with high restoration potential and (d) RB - areas that have recently burned and the type of habitat that is coming back and its restoration potential has not yet been determined. A new data set will be developed annually to update the planning map and chart landscape-level changes in sage-grouse habitat over time. Edits may also document refinements discovered through inventory, monitoring and modeleing. This data covers all of Idaho and a small area in Nevada that is managed by Idaho BLM. Intended scale of use is 1:100,000. </SPAN></P><P><SPAN>This dataset is not synonomous with BLM's "Preliminary Prioirty Hbitat" or "Preliminary General Habitat" mapping efforts, as those incorporate additional habitat and sage-grouse population data or models.</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></idAbs><idPurp>Concerns about sage-grouse habitat trends in Idaho have increased in recent years, particularly after the wildfires in eastern and south central Idaho since the latter 1990s. Sagebrush steppe vegetation mapping efforts have occurred in many areas but techniques, scales, timeframes, and resolution vary. Idaho Bureau of Land Management (BLM) and conservation partners have an ongoing need for a spatial portrayal of existing and potentially restorable sage-grouse habitat for a variety of planning purposes. At a broad scale, the Idaho BLM Greater Sage-Grouse Planning Maps and data are intended to: 1. Identify key sage-grouse habitat areas for Idaho BLM that need to be conserved. 2. Identify areas of restoration potential that should be considered during restoration planning. 3. Be a tool for land use and fire planning at the Field Office, District, and State Office levels. 4. Graphically portray the degree of sage-grouse habitat fragmentation or recovery as it changes over time. 5. Assist field staff in identifying areas where sage-grouse habitat conservation or restoration will be a primary concern and those areas where sage-grouse will not be a management emphasis. 6. Serve as an educational tool for conservation planning and public outreach.  </idPurp><idCredit>Idaho Department of Fish and Game, U.S. Forest Service, U.S. Department of Energy Idaho National Laboratory, Idaho Sage-grouse Local Working Groups, and other cooperators/contributors</idCredit><idStatus><ProgCd value="001" /></idStatus><idPoC><rpIndName>Paul Makela</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Wildlife Biologist/Sage-grouse Lead</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">(208) 373-3800</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>ID</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><country>UNITED STATES</country><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd></cntAddress><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="007" /></role></idPoC><resMaint><maintFreq><MaintFreqCd value="008" /></maintFreq><maintNote>This dataset is a snapshot in time.  A new version is created annually showing the status and changes in the habitat for that year.</maintNote><maintCont><rpIndName>Paul Makela</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Wildlife Biologist/Sage-grouse Lead</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="002" The User assumes the entire risk associated with its use of these data and bears all responsibility in determining whether these data are fit for the User\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds intended use. </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN /><SPAN /><SPAN><SPAN>The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the sources from which they were derived, and both scale and accuracy may vary across the data set. These data might not have the accuracy, resolution, completeness, timeliness, or other characteristics appropriate for applications that potential users of the data may contemplate. The User is encouraged to carefully consider the content of the metadata file associated with these data. These data are neither legal documents nor land surveys, and must not be used as such. Official records may be referenced at most BLM offices. Please report any errors in the data to the BLM office from which it was obtained. </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN /><SPAN /><SPAN><SPAN>The BLM should be cited as the data source in any products derived from these data. Any Users wishing to modify the data should describe the types of modifications they have performed. The User should not misrepresent the data, nor imply that changes made were approved or endorsed by BLM. This data may be updated by the BLM without notification. </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN>This dataset is not synonomous with BLM's "Preliminary Prioirty Hbitat" or "Preliminary General Habitat" mapping efforts, as those incorporate additional habitat and sage-grouse population data or models.</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></useLimit></Consts></resConst><resConst><SecConsts><class><ClasscationCd value="001" /></class><classSys>Executive Order 13292</classSys></SecConsts></resConst><dataLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="USA" Sync="TRUE" /></dataLang><suppInfo>The following map symbology is not a standard or requirement, but displays the classes in the colors that most BLM staff and partners are accustomed to viewing the data: red for Key Habitat, green for R1, yellow for R2, blue for R3 and gray for RB.</suppInfo><themeKeys><thesaLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="US" /></thesaLang><thesaName><resTitle>A-Z Index of U. S. Government Departments and Agencies, http://www.usa.gov/directory/federal/index.shtml</resTitle><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm></thesaName><keyword>Bureau of Land Management</keyword><keyword>BLM</keyword><keyword>Department of the Interior</keyword><keyword>DOI</keyword><keyword>Forest Service</keyword><keyword>U.S. Department of Agriculture</keyword><keyword>Department of Energy</keyword><keyword>DOE</keyword></themeKeys><themeKeys><thesaLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="US" /></thesaLang><thesaName><resTitle>State of Idaho, http://www.state.id.us/agency/agency_a.html </resTitle><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm></thesaName><keyword>Idaho Department of Fish and Game</keyword><keyword>IDFG</keyword></themeKeys><themeKeys><keyword>habitat</keyword><keyword>sagegrouse</keyword><keyword>disturbance</keyword><keyword>fire</keyword><keyword>restoration</keyword><keyword>fragmentation</keyword></themeKeys><dataChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></dataChar><dataScale><equScale><rfDenom>100000</rfDenom></equScale></dataScale><envirDesc Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3497</envirDesc><spatRpType><SpatRepTypCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></spatRpType><dataExt><geoEle xmlns=""><GeoBndBox esriExtentType="search"><exTypeCode Sync="TRUE">1</exTypeCode><westBL Sync="TRUE">-117.291716</westBL><eastBL Sync="TRUE">-110.880575</eastBL><northBL Sync="TRUE">45.338387</northBL><southBL Sync="TRUE">41.877540</southBL></GeoBndBox></geoEle></dataExt><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="002" /></tpCat><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="007" /></tpCat></dataIdInfo><mdMaint><maintFreq><MaintFreqCd value="011" /></maintFreq></mdMaint><mdConst><SecConsts><class><ClasscationCd value="001" /></class></SecConsts></mdConst><dqInfo><dqScope><scpLvl><ScopeCd value="005" /></scpLvl></dqScope><report type="DQTopConsis" dimension="horizontal"><evalMethDesc>A topology was created to find overlapping polygons and all discovered overlaps were fixed and validated. The Check Geometry tool was run on the feature class to make sure polygons were closed. There are gaps throughout the dataset, some of which are valid "holes" in the polygons, but many are slivers between habitat class types.  Polygons under 1 acre in size were merged with a neighboring polygon using the Eliminate command. </evalMethDesc><measDesc>Polygons should be closed and not overlap.</measDesc><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>All polygons under 1 acre in size were eliminated.</conExpl><conPass>1</conPass></ConResult></measResult><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="001" /></evalMethType><evalProc><resTitle>ArcGIS Topology Validation</resTitle></evalProc></report><report type="DQCompComm" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>The data is complete for the state of Idaho. It also includes a little land in Nevada that is managed by Idaho BLM.</measDesc><evalMethDesc>The data was compared to the field office boundary using a selection by location.</evalMethDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="001" /></evalMethType><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>All polygons are within the field office boundary layer.</conExpl><conPass>1</conPass></ConResult></measResult></report><report type="DQDomConsis" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>Class, admu_name, and parent_name should match the domains.</measDesc><evalMethDesc>Class, admu_name, and parent_name were sorted to make sure there were no null values for these fields. User names in the modify_by field were checked in Outlook and recalculated to the BLM user login name if they had been entered incorrectly. </evalMethDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="002" /></evalMethType></report><report type="DQAbsExtPosAcc" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>The accuracy of the polygon locations varies across the state depending on the scale of mapping, the method used to classify the land, and how recent the classification was done. Polygon locations may be even less accurate on non-BLM lands if land owners do not participate in the mapping effort. </measDesc><evalMethDesc>No formal horizontal positional accuracy testing has been done on this dataset. Field offices were given the chance to review the data for errors after editing by the State Office, and identified errors were corrected.</evalMethDesc></report><dataLineage><dataSource xmlns="" type=""><srcDesc>BLM Idaho Greater Sage-grouse Habitat 2012 - Undissolved (Polygon) porvided the base on which changes to vegetation that have occurried in 2012 due to fire, vegetation treatments, etc. are documented.  Inventory, monitoring and modeling may also refine knowledge about an area.</srcDesc><srcScale><rfDenom>100000</rfDenom></srcScale><srcMedName><MedNameCd value="015" /></srcMedName><srcRefSys><identAuth><resTitle>Annual Sage-Grouse Habitat Planning Maps</resTitle></identAuth></srcRefSys><srcCitatn><resTitle>BLM Idaho Greater Sage-grouse Habitat 2012 (Polygon)</resTitle><date><pubDate>2012-03-08T00:00:00</pubDate></date><otherCitDet>The data has been updated annually since 2006.  See each previous year's data for details.</otherCitDet><presForm><fgdcGeoform>vector digital data</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:15 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></srcCitatn></dataSource><prcStep xmlns=""><stepDesc>For consistency across the state the state data stewards listed several sets of data to be removed from the Key Habitat layer because they identified them as non-habitat.  - Municipal boundaries - Buffered Federal Highways o Interstate o US Highways - BLM Off Highway Vehicle (OHV) play areas and Forest service open areas - Water bodies greater than 40 acres.  A Union was made between DISTRICT_CI_Project_IDTM_83, HYDRO_OTH_NHDWaterbody_PUB_100K_POLY with a definition query of "gis_acres" > 40, ID_MT_OHV_Designations_BLM_USFS_08232013_IDTM with a definition query of "Comments" = 'Play Area', IDTM_Travel_Mgmt_Open_20130822_IDTM and StateHwys_Project_IDTM_83_InterstateUSHighways_Buffered_Final.  The Union created a feature class named Non_Habitat_Union_11222013, for the most up to date description of each Feature Class used in this Union please go to the Metadata of each Feature Class separately.  Using this created layer I used an Erase to erase out non-habitat from WLDLFE_SageGrouseHabitat_PUB_100K_POLY_2012 to create feature class WLDLFE_SageGrouseHabitat_PUB_100K_POLY_2013_EDIT_11252013. </stepDesc><stepDateTm>2013-11-25T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>TCooper</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>Idaho State Office</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>ID</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">(208) 373-3950</voiceNum><faxNum>(208) 373-3973</faxNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:15 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc><stepSrc type="used"><srcDesc>City Tax Districts downloaded from Idaho Tax Commssion website 9/26/2013 http://tax.idaho.gov/i-1071.cfm. District boundary changes and annexations submitted to the Idaho State Tax Commission throughout a calendar year will actually take effect during the next calendar year. For example: Requests submitted to the Tax Commission during the calendar year 2013 will take effect in the calendar year 2014.</srcDesc><srcCitatn><resTitle>DISTRICT_CI</resTitle></srcCitatn></stepSrc><stepSrc type="used"><srcDesc>The National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) is a feature-based database that interconnects and uniquely identifies the stream segments or reaches that comprise the nation's surface water drainage system. Medium resolution NHD is based on the content of the U.S. Geological Survey 1:100,000-scale Digital Line Graph (DLG) hydrography data, integrated with reach-related information from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Reach File Version 3.0 (RF3). More specifically, it contains reach codes for networked features and isolated lakes, flow direction, names, stream level, and centerline representations for areal water bodies. Reaches are also defined to represent water bodies and the approximate shorelines of the Great Lakes, the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans and the Gulf of Mexico. The NHD also incorporates the National Spatial Data Infrastructure framework criteria established by the Federal Geographic Data Committee.</srcDesc><srcCitatn><resTitle>HYDRO_OTH_NHDWaterbody_PUB_100K_POLY</resTitle></srcCitatn></stepSrc><stepSrc type="used"><srcDesc>This layer is intended to be a source of OHV designations in Idaho and Dillon/Butte Field Offices. StateHwys (Feature Class) Buffered Interstate category (Main) by 150 feet to create approximately a 400 foot total buffer on the main route of the Interstate.  Buffered the rest of the Interstate categories (Business Loop, Connector Road, Point of Entry Facility, Rest Area, Interstate Access Ramp and Spur Route) by 50 foot.  Buffered US Highways all by 50 feet.  Merged together and Dissolved.  Removed all islands around interchanges, between adjacent road ways and area islands created at rest areas. Buffers were discussed with data stewards, department of transportation and research was done in LR2000 and on the Master title plats.  Rights of ways vary throughout the state, so a collaborated overall offset was agreed upon.</srcDesc><srcCitatn><resTitle>StateHwys_Project_IDTM_83_InterstateUSHighways_Buffered_Final</resTitle><citRespParty><rpIndName>TCooper</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>ID</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">(208) 373-3950</voiceNum><faxNum>(208) 373-3973</faxNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:15 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></srcCitatn></stepSrc><stepSrc type=""><srcDesc>The Idaho Transportation Department (ITD) provides this geographic data and any associated metadata "as is" without warranty of any kind, including but not limited to its completeness, fitness for a particular use, or accuracy of its content, positional or otherwise. Please refer to previous years' data sets if you need to how the history, which are available from the Originator.</stepDesc><stepDateTm>2013-11-25T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>TCooper</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3793</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep xmlns=""><stepDesc>Data imported into SDE.</stepDesc><stepDateTm>2013-12-04T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>John C.</rpIndName><rpOrgName>Idaho State Office, Bureau of Land Management</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Analyst</rpPosName></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep xmlns=""><stepDesc>Boise District Edits to the 2013 Sage-grouse Habitat GIS data 1.  2013 Wildfires over 10 acres that fell within habitat were coded as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRB\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for recent burn.  Direction from Wildlife Biologists and ESR. 2. All polygons that had been called RB in 2012, were changed to R1 except for the Stout Fire, which was changed to R2.  Direction from ESR. 3. The USFS submitted new habitat as a shapefile (Wildlife Biologist Scott Bodle).  Two out of the 3 polygons were added, one near the Cayuse Creek/Menneke Creek drainages and one near Wilson Flat.  The other polygon was duplicated by an area added by Crudeen which is located just north of Anderson Ranch Reservoir.  Since Crudeen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds polygon appeared more refined, the decision was made to keep this polygon.  The two new polygons from Scott Bodle were coded as RB since they were part of the Pony/Elk fires. 4. 2012 Drill seeding polygons were used to change R2 habitat to R1.   Direction from ESR. 5. Consulted with the Four Rivers Wildlife Biologist about the GIS layer for croplands that fall within habitat.  Even though there were a couple areas with significant crops that were irrigated, he opted to keep these areas in the habitat layer.  First, the sage-grouse telemetry layer shows birds moving through these areas to access leks.  Also, there is a possibility that these lands could be rested or put into CRP lands which would make them more desirable to wildlife. 6. Upper Castle Creek Juniper Cut \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd used polygon to change R3 to Key.  Direction from Fuels NEPA team. </stepDesc><stepDateTm>2014-01-17T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>Christa Braun</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Boise District</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>3948 Development Avenue</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83705</postCode><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-384-3300</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep xmlns=""><stepDesc>Idaho field offices added to and edited this data to reflect changes to habitat that occurred in 2013 or resulting from field reconnaissance. Boise District Office provided more details on how they did this (see process step by Christa Braun).  </stepDesc><stepRat>Cottonwood and Coeur d'Alene Field Offices do not contribute data because they don't have greater sage-grouse populations or habitat.</stepRat><stepProc><rpIndName>U.S. Bureau of Land Managmenet, Idaho filed offices</rpIndName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3973</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:15 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc><stepDateTm>2014-01-20T00:00:00</stepDateTm></prcStep><prcStep xmlns=""><stepDesc>Deleted out Non-Habitat polygons.  The 2013 data was dissolved and multipart polygons were created to make it easier to use and display the information. The Idaho State Office data steward, Paul Makela, Wildlife Biologist, reviewed this data and signed the ID-9167 Geospatial Data Quality Assurance/Quality Control Authorization on March 21, 2014. This document is available in the Idaho State Office for review. </stepDesc><stepDateTm>2014-03-20T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>TCooper</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd></cntAddress></rpCntInfo></stepProc></prcStep></dataLineage><report type="DQThemClassCor" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>Vegetation types should be correctly class typed compared to what is on the ground.</measDesc><evalMethDesc>All class type attributes were reviewed by the GIS Specialists and Field Office Data Stewards. The accuracy of the class types varies across the state depending on the scale of mapping, the method used to classify the land, and how recent the classification was done. Class types may be even less accurate on non-BLM lands if land owners do not participate in the mapping effort. </evalMethDesc><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>No formal tests were done.  However, every year inventory, monitoring and modeling refines the data.  Howerver, logistics, funding and the changing environment prevent the BLM from ever having a completely accurate vegetation layer.</conExpl></ConResult></measResult></report></dqInfo><dataSetFn><OnFunctCd value="001" /></dataSetFn><eainfo><detailed Name="WLDLFE_SageGrouseHabitat_Dissolved_PUB_100K_POLY_2013"><enttyp><enttypl Sync="TRUE">WLDLFE_SageGrouseHabitat_Dissolved_PUB_100K_POLY_2013</enttypl><enttypd>Polygon attributes for Sage-grouse habitat</enttypd><enttypds>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Resources</enttypds><enttypt Sync="TRUE">Feature Class</enttypt><enttypc Sync="TRUE">5</enttypc></enttyp><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">FID</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">FID</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">OID</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef Sync="TRUE">Internal feature number.</attrdef><attrdefs Sync="TRUE">Esri</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>Class</attrlabl><attrdef>Habitat type, defined as K, R1, R2, R3, or RB. Please see Overview Description for attribute value definitions.</attrdef><attrdefs>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</attrdefs><attrdomv><edom><edomv>K</edomv><edomvd>Key Sage-grouse habitat</edomvd><edomvds>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</edomvds></edom><edom><edomv>R1</edomv><edomvd>Type 1 restoration habitat - Perennial native and non-native grasslands with high restoration potential.</edomvd><edomvds>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</edomvds></edom><edom><edomv>R2</edomv><edomvd>Type 2 restoration habitat - Annual grass dominated areas (either shrubland or grassland) with low restoration potential.</edomvd><edomvds>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</edomvds></edom><edom><edomv>R3</edomv><edomvd>Type 3 restoration habitat - Conifer encroachment areas with high restoration potential.</edomvd><edomvds>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</edomvds></edom><edom><edomv>RB</edomv><edomvd>Recent burn. Areas recently burned in a fire or fires and the habitat class is pending verification.</edomvd><edomvds>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Resources and Sciences</edomvds></edom></attrdomv><attalias Sync="TRUE">Class</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">2</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">Shape</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">Shape</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Geometry</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">0</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef Sync="TRUE">Feature geometry.</attrdef><attrdefs Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Coordinates defining the features.</udom></attrdomv></attr></detailed><overview><eaover>CLASS attribute values  Key Habitat Areas (K): Areas of generally intact sagebrush that provide sage-grouse habitat during some portion of the year including winter, spring, summer, late brood-rearing, fall, transition sites from winter to spring, spring to summer, and summer/fall to winter. Key habitat may or may not provide adequate nesting, early brood-rearing, and winter cover due to elevation, snow depth, lack of early season forbs, limited herbaceous cover, or small sagebrush patch size.  Note: In some cases, biologists may suspect sage grouse occupancy but documentation is lacking.  Local biologists should use professional judgement in determining the extent of the habitat polygons, with an explicit goal of conserving occupied and potentially occupied sage grouse habitat.  Restoration Habitats:  Restoration Type I (R1): Perennial Grasslands. Sagebrush-limited areas characterized by perennial grass species composition and/or structure that should provide suitable potential nesting habitat in the future, once sufficient sagebrush cover is re-established. Includes native and/or introduced perennial bunchgrasses. These sites have the potential to be restored to good ecological condition for sage grouse through natural recovery or by seeding/planting sagebrush. These areas need to be protected from future wildfires to facilitate recovery. Sage grouse may use these sites during summer, late brood-rearing, or fall, depending on forb and sagebrush availability.  After restoration or recovery of sagebrush (>=10% canopy cover), these sites may become key habitat, and may also help to link or reconnect isolated sage grouse populations. Note: Such areas are often a result of  wildfires or seedings.  Restoration Type II (R2): Annual Grass Understories. Areas dominated or strongly influenced by invasive annuals such as cheatgrass (Bromus tectorum), medusahead rye (Taeniatherum caputmedusae) or similar species. Areas with sagebrush may be present, but, in general, understories are not suitable for sage grouse. R2 habitats may be re-classified as R1 once a restoration seeding has been determined to be successful based on local evaluation. Note: These areas often result initially from the expansion of invasive exotic herbaceous species into native or marginal seeded rangelands, and are then exacerbated and eventually maintained  by frequent wildfire. Lack of direct management intervention will likely lead  to perpetual dominance by the invasive species,  a shortening of fire return intervals, and loss of shrubs, depending on the site.  Restoration Type III (R3): Conifer Encroachment. Areas where junipers and/or other conifer species are encroaching into sage grouse habitat areas. Opportunities exist for improving habitat through appropriate fire management, prescribed fire, chemical, or mechanical methods. R3 habitats may be re-classified as R1, R2 or key as appropriate once conifer control efforts have been completed. Note: Some sage grouse habitats occurring at or near the sagebrush-steppe-conifer woodland interface are at risk to conifer encroachment or have already been rendered unsuitable for sage grouse due to conifer expansion.  Retarding juniper expansion in such situations, with a goal of shrub-steppe restoration, may be advisable.  Recent Burn (RB): Areas recently burned in a fire or fires and the habitat class is pending verification. </eaover></overview></eainfo><mdHrLvName Sync="TRUE">dataset</mdHrLvName><refSysInfo><RefSystem><refSysID><identCode code="102605" Sync="TRUE" value="102605" /><idCodeSpace Sync="TRUE">ESRI</idCodeSpace><idVersion Sync="TRUE">10.2.1</idVersion></refSysID></RefSystem></refSysInfo><spatRepInfo><VectSpatRep><geometObjs Name="WLDLFE_SageGrouseHabitat_Dissolved_PUB_100K_POLY_2013"><geoObjTyp><GeoObjTypCd value="002" Sync="TRUE" /></geoObjTyp><geoObjCnt Sync="TRUE">5</geoObjCnt></geometObjs><topLvl><TopoLevCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></topLvl></VectSpatRep></spatRepInfo><spdoinfo><ptvctinf><esriterm Name="WLDLFE_SageGrouseHabitat_Dissolved_PUB_100K_POLY_2013"><efeatyp Sync="TRUE">Simple</efeatyp><efeageom code="4" Sync="TRUE" /><esritopo Sync="TRUE">FALSE</esritopo><efeacnt Sync="TRUE">5</efeacnt><spindex Sync="TRUE">FALSE</spindex><linrefer Sync="TRUE">FALSE</linrefer></esriterm></ptvctinf></spdoinfo></metadata>
